html:
physician. Used here, the term refers to someone who binds up wounds or sores. The same Hebrew root is used in 1:6: the "wounds, and bruises, and putrifying sores" of Israel "have not been closed, neither bound up, neither [softened] with ointment."

neither bread nor clothing. It is unclear why the man denies having clothing. Perhaps he has insufficient for the group—or maybe he simply does not want the responsibility of leading the others during such troubled times.
